issue.title: Fix signatures of BaseEntity.

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
Fix signatures of `BaseEntity`.
It seems that an argument `criteria` and `conditions` allow `FindConditions` instead of `DeepPartial`.
Them arguments of `Repository` was changed at #1846, but one of `BaseEntity` was not changed..

body: @pleerock can you update the NPM version? I need this fix urgent too. Thanks!
This issue still without upgrade version in npm from two weeks ago, as I see it's already released, but not deployed. I'm so interested in so interested why it's not in npm avail for now

I updated to the latest version 0.2.12 today, and still see the error "Type 'FindOperator<string>' is not assignable to type 'string'", I'm using Like<T> 

So.. seems the fix doesn't work.

issue.title: error TS2322: Type 'FindOperator<string>' is not assignable to type 'string'

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
What the reason this differences?

**Issue type:**

[ ] question
[x] bug report
[ ] feature request
[ ] documentation issue

**Database system/driver:**

[ ] `cordova`
[ ] `mongodb`
[ ] `mssql`
[ ] `mysql` / `mariadb`
[ ] `oracle`
[x] `postgres`
[ ] `sqlite`
[ ] `sqljs`
[ ] `react-native`
[ ] `expo`

**TypeORM version:**

[x] `latest`
[ ] `@next`
[x] `0.2.12` (or put your version here)


Hello. My question is about https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/docs/find-options.md.
I can't use condition "In" at Entity.find method.

```
    Group.find({ name: Like("%abc") })
```
Type 'FindOperator<string>' is not assignable to type 'string'
And I saw here https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/src/find-options/operator/Like.ts

```
/**
 * Find Options Operator.
 * Example: { someField: Like("%some sting%") }
 */
```

As my code did nothing wrong but Typescript is treating { someField: Like("%some sting%") } as assignment rather than query.

body: I'll publish a new version this weekend
@pleerock has this issued been addressed? seems also related to https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/2904. thank you

I am getting these too. Pretty simple use case:

```ts
    // create a new entity instance using the repository
    const crawlRequest = this.crawlRequestRepo.create(req)

    // now try to save it - fails here ...
    await this.crawlRequestRepo.save(crawlRequest)
```

Error raised:

```
const crawlRequet: CrawlRequest
Argument of type 'CrawlRequest' is not assignable to parameter of type 'DeepPartial<CrawlRequest>'.
  Types of property 'iterations' are incompatible.
    Type 'CrawlIteration[]' is not assignable to type 'DeepPartial<CrawlIteration>[]'.
      Type 'CrawlIteration' is not assignable to type 'DeepPartial<CrawlIteration>'.
        Types of property 'results' are incompatible.

           ... and on and on it goes for every column
```

In fact, just instantiating an entity manually, yields to the same result!

```ts
const cr = new CrawlRequest()
await this.crawlRequestRepo.save(crawlRequest)
```

Same error!

issue.title: Allow active record entities to use find conditions

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
**Issue type:**

[ ] question
[ ] bug report
[ ] feature request
[x] documentation issue

**Database system/driver:**

[ ] `cordova`
[ ] `mongodb`
[ ] `mssql`
[ ] `mysql` / `mariadb`
[ ] `oracle`
[ ] `postgres`
[x] `sqlite`
[ ] `sqljs`
[ ] `react-native`
[ ] `expo`

**TypeORM version:**

[ ] `latest`
[ ] `@next`
[x] `0.2.7`

**Description:**
Current type declaration doesn't allow for use of FindConditions on active record entities, even though according to [BaseEntity.ts#L259](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/src/repository/BaseEntity.ts#L259) the options are directly passed to [Repository.find](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/src/repository/Repository.ts#L218), which clearly accepts `FindConditions`.

**Current workaround:**
```ts
ActiveRecordEntity.find(findConditions as any);
```

_Not sending PR as I'm new to typescript and don't feel confident enough to touch type related part of the codebase myself. Tagging as documentation issue as it's not a technical bug, rather an inconvenience_
